VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV420pl

Functions

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV420pl (const uint8_t *yc, uint32_t width, int32_t pitch, uint32_t height, uint8_t *restrict y, uint8_t *restrict cr, uint8_t *restrict cb)

Function Documentation

int32_t VLIB_convertUYVYint_to_YUV420pl ( const uint8_t *  yc,
uint32_t  width,
int32_t  pitch,
uint32_t  height,
uint8_t *restrict  y,
uint8_t *restrict  cr,
uint8_t *restrict  cb 
)

Introduction and Use Cases:
YUV420 is a common imaging data format. It offers more compressed chroma data and thus a reduced bandwidth over YUV422. If the YUV422 color channels are interleaved, as is often the case, this function is usually beneficial for improving the performance of vision applications, as it separates the three color channels into separate buffers, color planes. This is helpful because data transfers between external and internal memory are faster for contiguous data.
Description:
Given pixels in the YUV422 interleaved format, this function separates the three channels into separate buffers, and vertically subsamples the chroma information by a factor of 2 to generate YUV420 planar format. To prevent aliasing in the chroma data, the values extracted from YUV422 are averaged.
Parameters:
[in] *yc Interleaved luma/chroma (UQ8.0)
[in] width Width of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] pitch Pitch of input image (number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[in] height Height of input image(number of luma pixels) (in pixels)
[out] *y Luma plane (8-bit) (in pixels)
[out] *cr Cr chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
[out] *cb Cb chroma plane (8-bit) (UQ8.0)
Assumptions
  • All arrays should be 64-bit aligned.
  • width should be a multiple of 8, and greater than 0
  • height should be a multiple of 2, and greater than 0
  • pitch should be a multiple of 4, and >= width
Benchmarks:
See VLIB_Test_Report.html for cycle and memory information.
References:
  1. Digital Image Processing by R.C.Gonzales and R.E.Woods, Prentice-Hall, 2007
